instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.LP8550: What is LP8550? This is an LED driver responsible for creating the backlight on the LCD screen of Macbooks from 2011 through 2015.
definitions.PPHV_S0SW_LCDBKLT: What is PPHV_S0SW_LCDBKLT? PPHV_S0SW_LCDBKLT is a power rail that powers the backlight on the LCD screen, this is necessary to get the screen to light up..
definitions.SMC_ONOFF: What is SMC_ONOFF? SMC_ONOFF is a signal that tells the machine that the power button has been pressed so it knows to turn on, or turn off. .
definitions.SMC_RESET: What is SMC_RESET? SMC_RESET is not a signal, it is an abbreviation for “SMC_RESET_L”, which is the signal someone is referring to when they type “SMC_RESET”  "SMC_RESET_L is a signal that resets the SMC when it is low(this is what the “_L” prefix means), and lets the SMC out of reset mode when it is high. .

threads.title: 000165 alternating green and orange light
threads.message:
Had a 000165 come from another shop, they already USC'd it. Apparently there was liquid damage. The only evidence I see of this is a corroded probe point (TP{1}<SIGNAL>PPVOUT_SW_LCDBKLT_FB</SIGNAL>), and some stuff around <CHIP>U7701</CHIP>. Changed <CHIP>U7701</CHIP>, all pads looked good, tested continuity on ones in questions, they were fine. Put new one on and still the charger alternates green then orange at 3 second intervals, no chime, no display, no backlight, no fan.

0V on backlight pins (of course, its not powering on).
O.L on <SIGNAL>PPHV_S0SW_LCDBKLT</SIGNAL> (screen connected and disconnected)

I should mention that there was display, chime and fan before changing out the <CHIP>LP8550</CHIP>... Didnt just do it for the fun of it.

Ideas?

threads.title: 000165 alternating green and orange light
threads.message: Inpect closely under microscope, seems to be crap under SMC, first try another IO board and cable......

threads.title: 000165 alternating green and orange light
threads.message: Light will only go green if SMC is reset. Check <SIGNAL>SMC_RESET</SIGNAL> and <SIGNAL>SMC_ONOFF</SIGNAL>, PPBUS voltage? Disconnect everything from the board.
